website_summaries.verdict: The general feedback for the Salomon Alphacross GTX has been positive. Consumers are mostly happy with this trail running shoe’s responsiveness, breathability, and lightweight construction. People also appreciated the shoe’s cushioning system, durability, and gripping ability. The shoe is also good for workouts and casual walks. Only a few consumers dislike that shoe is a bit expensive and the insole is too firm.
pros: The stylish and robust design of Salomon Alphacross GTX is praised by several consumers
This Salomon trail running shoe fits well and is very comfortable to wear, according to many reviewers
Salomon Alphacross GTX’s gripping ability is good in both wet and dry surfaces, some runners mentioned
A few commenters appreciated this running gear’s shock absorption ability
This running shoe is also good for workouts and casual walks, many users claimed
Salomon Alphacross GTX’s lightweight structure gained positive feedback from several runners who have tried it
People lauded the breathability of this shoe’s upper unit
Numerous wearers commented that the midsole is supportive and responsive to the foot’s movement
A couple of reviewers explained that the shoe offers just the right amount of cushioning, not too soft nor too firm
cons: The insole of the Salomon Alphacross GTX is not soft enough, according to a tester
A purchaser reported that the shoe doesn’t perform well in mud
The shoe is expensive, some buyers state

customer_reviews.title: Be warned - very narrow fit (and I have slender feet)
customer_reviews.text: THIS is not a vine review of a free product. I paid for these, then returned them to Amazon. It is a very good-looking shoe, with a solid rubber sole, and nice detailing. It seemed to provide all I was looking for - subtle detailing, good padding and waterproof lining. I ordered a size 8.5. The length was good and I had plenty of space there. I also have fairly slender feet. These trainers were incredibly narrow and painful to wear. There was no point getting the next size up, because they would still be too narrow. It's a shame because it's a good looking shoe. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Ravi M. Naik

customer_reviews.title: As Expected
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear Speedcross4 trail shoes, saw these on offer so thought give a try. Used on a very muddy run last weekend. Fit: as expected from Salomon very snug. Quality: grip was fine, but I think very similar to Speedcross4, the Goretex kept my feet dry until the water levels came over the top. will have to see how they hold up compared to the 4's in time. Bad points (for me): Laces. With the 4's you lock the system and forget about it until you are done. I was conscious of the laces and with muddy gloved hands, or in a race, I don't want to worry about laces!
customer_reviews.author: Flipside06

customer_reviews.title: Really not sure about these
customer_reviews.text: So I was very pleased when the shoes arrived as really good fit , an really comfortable. I got them on the 26 th March. I wear them daily for walks an runs in the park. Not even two months old an grips on sole nearly worn out , sole is coming away . An the shoe has come apart a lil bit on the top , hence not waterproof anymore . As say ,not even two months old . See pics.
customer_reviews.author: Russell lambert

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t sure about the colour when I bought them but they were too good a price and in person it’s a really nice copper colour. More importantly, they are very comfortable and waterproof like it says on the tin! I’ve worn them in very heavy rain and in long, wet grass and they kept my feet bone dry. Lighter weight than my other Salomon GTX and more flexible. Closer to a running shoe than a trail running shoe. That is exactly what I was after. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: David N

customer_reviews.title: Ultra comfortable, at least so far.
customer_reviews.text: Having worn several pairs of Salomon trail running shoes over the years, I thought I knew just what I was getting. But these are amazingly comfortable shoes (for me, at least). The sole seems a tiny bit grippy but I expect it to wear a little better than my previous, much loved Speed Cross 4s. Initial impressions very good.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hayter

customer_reviews.title: Only for really narrow feet.
customer_reviews.text: Far too narrow. Lovely design and colour. Fitting comes up as slightly too long but very narrow. I argued that I could keep them until I took them off and saw my feet. They cut the blood off to my toes and I watched the colour change. Only order if you have really narrow feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great trail shoes from the off
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable straight out of the box. I went for half a size larger and glad I did because they fit perfectly. The Gortex is quite good at keeping the wet out and the grip is good on any surface First time out did a 2 and a half hour trail run on everything from tarmac, grass, rough stones and wet rocks. No problems at all, would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Marky

customer_reviews.title: Bad for your lower back, rock solid
customer_reviews.text: The sizes quoted are too small. This actual pair went missing from my front door box of shoes very shortly after covid, I then went and purchased a second pair, 6 weeks in and I have lower back pain, bought a pair of new balance today and I am nearly cured of 2 months of pain in a couple of hours.. I can only speak the truth... might have cost me a substantial amount but there going to the bin in the morning, new balance all the way..
customer_reviews.author: Barry W.

customer_reviews.title: Quality a little below normal for Salomon
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been buying Salomon for as long as I can remember. Even with the rubber bottom I wear them everywhere. Normally I buy speed cross and I get them for my whole family of five. I just bought two pairs of alpha cross to check them out and the green pair had a small collapse in the shape at the toes on the right trainer. Normally Salomon are quality all over so this little dent is a first and making me wonder if the quality has dropped.
customer_reviews.author: charles

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely delighted with the fit is these trainers, fit perfect and looking forward to putting then to good use in my quest for fitness
customer_reviews.author: Kirsty

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing and comfortable. Completely Waterproof and very good for trekking
customer_reviews.author: defected

customer_reviews.title: Exact fit, cumfy and waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I bought half a size down, but returned them for the exact size and they fit perfect - really cumfy to wear both running and walking - very grippy and so far are living up to their waterproof promise. Very happy with these!
customer_reviews.author: Pat Mcd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for walking or running
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoes. Worn as walking shoes (dog walker) for upto 5 hours a day, waterproof, lightweight & comfortable. I ordered a half size up as I know Salomans are always a little narrow. Ran 5k trail today in them, excellent again. Thoroughly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rebel Yell

customer_reviews.title: Great quality waterproof trainers!
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of trainers if you are looking for a waterproof, grippy and warm pair. Used daily for dog walking across fields in all weathers. No wet socks at all and not loss of grip in the mud. Very good shoes!
customer_reviews.author: jwtenniscoach

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality
customer_reviews.text: Worn out within 6 weeks. The back support has split and now causes blisters. I though these were brilliant for the fist 4 weeks now I feel they are not fit for purpose
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Good fit, first trial walk over 25km and feet were cool and comfortable throughout.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Keelan

customer_reviews.title: Great grip
customer_reviews.text: Love salomons anyway and have had them regularly for a few years, these don't disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Kim GG

customer_reviews.title: thin fit too small - slow refund
customer_reviews.text: thin fit too small - slow refund, need i say more?
customer_reviews.author: Genuine

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and comfortable, slippy on wet pavements but great on wet mud or dry shingles
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The wisdom of Salamon.
customer_reviews.text: Such amazing quality, really comfortable. Everything I've come to expect from salomon.
customer_reviews.author: Mr J Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit. Comfortable straight out the box. No rubbing or blisters. Very good shoe and a great price. Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: MR EUAN G HAY

customer_reviews.title: Shoes for all terrain and all weather
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous comfort and fit. A delight to run through woods and trails. Excellent traction. Walking on pavements is equally pleasant. Waterproof and breathable. Superb value at £70.
customer_reviews.author: CVS

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for Apres Ski
customer_reviews.text: Buy half a size larger, great shoe and keeps you dry.. well. As long as the snow isnt more than a few inches deep
customer_reviews.author: JSM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes! Light, water-proof, comfortable, suitable for both running and everyday walking.
customer_reviews.author: citeee

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof for long
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable from the start and lightweight but only had them two months and water in getting into toe area and wetting socks and feet so very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Good support
customer_reviews.text: A little snug, but can't keep it on for too long (over 2 hours) as I cross train in them - early days yet, and I hope more comfy by the day.
customer_reviews.author: Al Irot

customer_reviews.title: Great, well made all round trainer.
customer_reviews.text: So far l'm really happy with the trainers. They keep my feet dry and cool. Like the fact they are discreet. So l get away with wearing them at work. Would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: J Grabowski

customer_reviews.title: Curates Egg
customer_reviews.text: Slightly narrow. Laces not quite long enough. Good quality and well made but need time to break in ...
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Superb Comfort
customer_reviews.text: This model is the best and most comfy among the rest of Salomons I have ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Lovely trainers that fit lovely, maybe half a size bigger if you to have wide fitting feet
customer_reviews.author: Phil M.

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality better than any Nike or any top brands 😁
customer_reviews.author: robert muir

customer_reviews.title: Grip
customer_reviews.text: I have to get use to the shoes' grip. Overall, great product
customer_reviews.author: Matteo Franconi

product_meta.title: SALOMON Men's Alphacross GTX Trail Running Shoes
product_meta.description: The Alphacross GTX trail running shoes are your new ideal friend, just as suited to your daily workout in the park as they are to harsher terrain. Protection: The waterproof GORE-TEX membrane will keep your feet dry, whatever the weather. Comfort: The Ortholite insole, the mesh upper and the ripstop fabric make this shoe comfortable from the very first time you wear it. Grip: The Contagrip chevron sole with deep heels offers multidirectional grip, improving traction on soft and slippery surfaces. Cushioning: The midsole improves shock-absorption and durability thanks to the EnergyCell compound. Fit: The traditional shoelaces allow you to tie the shoes manually to achieve the ideal fit for you. Lightness: Enjoy a lightweight shoe (average weight 329 g) for your daily workout.
